name: PLATINUM
descr: [PLATINUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0068) is an activity group that has targeted victims since at least 2009. The group has focused on targets associated with governments and related organizations in South and Southeast Asia. (Citation: Microsoft PLATINUM April 2016)

technique_table_data.name: Drive-by Compromise
technique_table_data.descr: [PLATINUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0068) has sometimes used drive-by attacks against vulnerable browser plugins.(Citation: Microsoft PLATINUM April 2016)

technique_table_data.name: Exploitation for Privilege Escalation
technique_table_data.descr: [PLATINUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0068) has leveraged a zero-day vulnerability to escalate privileges.(Citation: Microsoft PLATINUM April 2016)

technique_table_data.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
technique_table_data.descr: [PLATINUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0068) has transferred files using the Intel® Active Management Technology (AMT) Serial-over-LAN (SOL) channel.(Citation: Microsoft PLATINUM June 2017)

subtechniques.name: Keylogging
subtechniques.descr: [PLATINUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0068) has used several different keyloggers.(Citation: Microsoft PLATINUM April 2016)

subtechniques.name: Credential API Hooking
subtechniques.descr: [PLATINUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0068) is capable of using Windows hook interfaces for information gathering such as credential access.(Citation: Microsoft PLATINUM April 2016)

technique_table_data.name: Masquerading
technique_table_data.descr: [PLATINUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0068) has renamed rar.exe to avoid detection.(Citation: Twitter ItsReallyNick Platinum Masquerade)

technique_table_data.name: Non-Application Layer Protocol
technique_table_data.descr: [PLATINUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0068) has used the Intel® Active Management Technology (AMT) Serial-over-LAN (SOL) channel for command and control.(Citation: Microsoft PLATINUM June 2017)

subtechniques.name: LSASS Memory
subtechniques.descr: [PLATINUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0068) has used keyloggers that are also capable of dumping credentials.(Citation: Microsoft PLATINUM April 2016)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
subtechniques.descr: [PLATINUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0068) has sent spearphishing emails with attachments to victims as its primary initial access vector.(Citation: Microsoft PLATINUM April 2016)

technique_table_data.name: Process Injection
technique_table_data.descr: [PLATINUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0068) has used various methods of process injection including hot patching.(Citation: Microsoft PLATINUM April 2016)

subtechniques.name: Malicious File
subtechniques.descr: [PLATINUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0068) has attempted to get users to open malicious files by sending spearphishing emails with attachments to victims.(Citation: Microsoft PLATINUM April 2016)

techniques.name: File and Directory Permissions Modification
techniques.sub_name: Windows File and Directory Permissions Modification

Microsoft PLATINUM April 2016.description: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Hunting Team. (2016, April 29). PLATINUM: Targeted attacks in South and Southeast Asia. Retrieved February 15, 2018.

Microsoft PLATINUM June 2017.description: Kaplan, D, et al. (2017, June 7). PLATINUM continues to evolve, find ways to maintain invisibility. Retrieved February 19, 2018.

Twitter ItsReallyNick Platinum Masquerad.description: Carr, N.. (2018, October 25). Nick Carr Status Update. Retrieved September 12, 2024.
